feed.title: SAP Community - Cloud Integration
feed.subtitle: Cloud Integration Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: CPI and Azure storage adapter - huge file size issue - file not read completely from the blob
entry.content:
Hi,

We have a simple flow to get the json file from the storage container and then send it to HTTPS
We have worked with files as big as 87 MB and there was never any issue
However, it is failing with a larger file of 105 MB and it seems that even in the download section in trace, the file is not downloaded fully which means that the iflow did not pick up the full file
I downloaded the message payload but the file is incomplete and what i need to resolve why the message payload is incomplete in the iflow and how can the complete file be processed
When this incomplete message hits the HTTPS which is then received by the REST which is expecting a fully formed JSON, it fails
The iflow is just passing the data payload to target as the target is expecting full and valid json payload, it raises the exception
So i need to be able to find why the payload from the blob is not coming through in full

The flow is really simple -

Connect to the Blob container
Read the JSON data file (this file will be the ONLY file always and is overwritten by the new file on a daily basis with the same name)
Send the data file records to PI REST Sender adapter and get it processed by SAP inbound proxy

The List Blob operation is via the Receiver Azure Storage Adapter with message protocol as BLOB Storage
So how to confirm that the file is not read fully or is incomplete?
Azure Storage adapter is standard
The actual GET to access the file in the blob after get Blob is HTTP as per the examples in the few blogs that i could find
Is there another way to read the data file in the blob container via Azure Storage adapter as i have not seen any operation for actually getting the file data?

So is there a standard way to send JSON data to PI from CPI/Azure Blob?
Can you please advise (maybe some blogs and links that i can check)?

I have also checked the option of doing a local process call but not sure what condition to use to do the loop or terminate.

I even tried looking at the blog where the file is downloaded by the groovy script/using azure storage jar file but i am getting some error by using the same connection that i am using in the iflow to successfully connect to the azure blob

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-members/get-file-from-azureblob-using-cpi-using-azure-storage-jar/ba-p/13503570

Any advise is also appreciated 

Regards,

Archana

entry.title: SAP PO 7.5 to SAP CPI Neo Tenant Migration
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

We have a client based out of UAE for which there is no SAP CPI CF data center available so they are on SAP CPI Neo[Already checked with SAP, cannot be moved to CF].

Now, we are planning to do SAP PO to SAP CPI Neo tenant migration. Have few questions, request you to please guide if someone has done migration using Neo tenant.

1) Is the Migration Assessment tool available for SAP CPI Neo Tenant to link SAP PO system and get the dashboard for Assessment?

2) Is it possible to Migrate through the tool in the neo tenant.

3) Any difficulties to be considered while migration to Neo tenant from SAP PO?

Thanks,

Nidhi Srivastava

entry.title: Range based Select operation on Datastore using any header or groovy script
entry.content:
Here's my scenario:

  • The Datastore contains 100+ entries.
  • The iflow receives a query parameter start_index from the HTTPS request.
  • Based on this, the iflow should return entries from start_index to start_index + offset, where offset is a configurable property (e.g., 10).

Is there any standard SAP header or a groovy script which can be leveraged to achieve this kind of paginated Select operation on the Datastore?

entry.title: Using Function Import on oData v 2.0 API_OUTBOUND_DELIVERY_SRV;v=0002 to perform PickOneItem
entry.content:
Using Function Import on oData v 2.0 to perform PickOneItem.  I can get it to work in Postman but I receive the error ‚Äúcom.sap.gateway.core.ip.component.odata.exception.OsciException: Precondition Required : 428 : HTTP/1.1‚Äù in CPI.

My assumption is that this is related to the if-match header with the etag but as far as I can see this is correct.

These are the steps I have gone through in Postman to prove the API works

  1. Run the GET method of the odata to retrieve the CSRF and the etag
    https://xxxx.xxxx.xxxx.xxxx:xxxx/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_OUTBOUND_DELIVERY_SRV;v=0002/A_OutbDeliveryItem?$filter=DeliveryDocument eq '83782271' and DeliveryDocumentItem eq '000010'
  2. Retrieved the csrf from the x-csrf-token and the etag from the body
  3. Executed the PickOneItem odata
    https://xxxx.xxxx.xxxx.xxxx:xxxx/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_OUTBOUND_DELIVERY_SRV;v=0002/PickOneItem?DeliveryDocument='83782271'&DeliveryDocumentItem='10'
    Copying the CSRF into the x-csrf-token and the etag into the If-Match parameter from 2
  4. This resulted in the picked item quantity being set to the delivered quantity as expected for this item

I then created an iFlow to replicate this as shown in attachment

 

On the PickOneItem I get the error com.sap.gateway.core.ip.component.odata.exception.OsciException: Precondition Required : 428 : HTTP/1.1. 

Any ideas as to suggestions as to what I have missed?

entry.title: PKIX path building failed Cloud Integration
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

We are getting the connectivity error between iflow (HTTP receiver adapter) and IBM MQ in SAP Integration Suite (Cloud Integration).. It was working fine until yesterday..

Error code on Monitoring: (screenshot2)

Error code HTTP response body:

javax.net.ssl.SSLHandshakeException: sun.security.validator.ValidatorException: PKIX path building failed: sun.security.provider.certpath.SunCertPathBuilderException: unable to find valid certification path to requested target..

we have imported all the Root and Issuing certificates shared by IBM MQ team (screenshot1)

Should we also import server certificate of IBM MQ server?

 

Regards,

Ramu.

entry.title: Compound Employee API Query
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I have a requirement to fetch data from SF Employee compound API based on conditions like last_modified_on >= last run date or employment start date = today or employment end date = today.
Since OR operation is not supported, I tried to call these 3 queries separately, first using condition of last modified date, then employment_end_date and start date (this is a general one as I am not able to do nested query). Then merge all of these together and filter them. But employment_end_date query is giving complete data in the response along with the requested data,if present.
What is the best way to achieve this scenario.
Thanks & Regards,
Keerthana

entry.title: Creation of User Roles in Integration Suite with API
entry.content:
Hello,
I would like to create Integration Suite (Cloud Integration) User Roles via API, but there is no documented API. In API Business Hub I can find APIs for many objects, but not for User Roles (https://api.sap.com/api/SecurityContent/resource).

In the UI I can create user roles via http://xxx.integrationsuite.cfapps.eu20-001.hana.ondemand.com/shell/monitoring/UserRoles, which uses the endpoint https://xxx.integrationsuite.cfapps.eu20-001.hana.ondemand.com/rest/api/v1/tenants/roles/customroles

Unfortunately, this endpoint uses a cookie to authenticate. Any idea how I could create a User Roles using an API?

Thanks,
Maximilian

entry.title: Getting Started with SAP Open Connectors
entry.content:
Introduction to SAP Open Connectors

In today‚Äôs fast-paced digital landscape, seamless integration across various systems and applications is crucial for business success. SAP Open Connectors, a key capability within the SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP), is designed to simplify and accelerate this process.

SAP Open Connectors offers a unified API integration layer that streamlines connectivity to over 160 third-party cloud applications, including popular platforms like Salesforce, Microsoft Dynamics, Google services, and more.

Instead of building and maintaining individual connectors for each application, Open Connectors provides prebuilt connectors with standardized APIs, helping developers avoid the complexity of dealing with diverse authentication methods, pagination formats, error handling, and data models.

Assign Roles in BTP

  • OpenConnectorsAdmin
  • OpenConnectorsUser
  • OpenConnectorsDeveloper

Prerequisites:

  • SAP BTP account (Open Connectors supports trial accounts)

Demonstrate on how to connect Gmail API Connector

Firstly, Add the capabilities for Open Connectors on the Integration Suite. After that, we should assign the role related to Open Connectors.

Step 1: Integration suite Home page >> Capabilities >> Manage Capabilities. Click on ‚ÄúManage Capabilities‚Äù.

Step 2: Click on ‚ÄúAdd Capabilities‚Äù

Step 3: Click on check box i.e., Extend Non-Sap Connectivity

Step 4: After the above step, you will see the below mentioned in Home Page. Click on ‚ÄúCreate Connectors‚Äù. After this step, you will be navigate to Open Connectors Home Page.

Open Connectors Configuration

Now, we will be working on Gmail Connector. After navigating to Open Connectors Home Page. You will be able to see the below page. Just, Search for the Gmail in search box.  

Connectors >> Gmail >> My Resources (place the cursor in Gmail connector, then only you can see the Resources) >> Authenticate Instance.

I am creating a new instance with the name of ‚ÄúDemoGmail‚Äù.

After this step, you will be redirected to a different page or click this url 

  • https://console.cloud.google.com/

Get Gmail OAuth Credentials 

  • Create a new project or use existing
  • Click on "Select a project".

Give Project Name as Your wish. e.g. My Project - 1 >> Click on "Create". In the search bar, type Gmail API >> Click on Gmail API >> Click Enable.

After enabling your API, you will be redirect to another page.

At this Step:

  • Navigate to Credentials
  • Click on Create Credential
  • Select OAuth client ID

 

  • Click on "Configure consent screen".

  • Click on "Get Started" which is highlighted in blue color.

Give all the details

  • App name: Test
  • User support email: "Give your mail id e.g. xxxx@gmail.com"
  • Choose "External"
  • Contact Information: Give your mail id
  • Click "Agree" checkbox >> Continue >> Create

When you have this page, click on "Create OAuth client".

Fill the details as mentioned in below Image.

Skip "Authorized JavaScript origins"

In "Authorized redirect URIs", Click "Add URI" >> give the urI as mentioned in below image >> Click on "Create". 

Download your credentials by clicking on Download JSON or else you can copy & paste in your notepad. Click on OK.

Go to Hamburger button which is located on Top Left side. You can see API & Services as shown in below image. click on it.

API & Services >> Credentials >> Audience >> Add Users (add your mail id) >> click on "Save".

 Data Access >> Add or remove scopes >> add below scopes >> add to table >> click on update.

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/gmail.send

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/gmail.readonly

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/gmail.modify

Navigate to your open connectors, give your client credentials, create instance.

You will see the below page with success popup.

Click on Test in the API docs

GET: Retrieves data or resources from the server (ex: fetch mail messages). Follow the below images highlighted with red rectangle. 

When you're complete your execution, if no errors you will get 200 message.

entry.title: Need Help Saving Data Before SAP BTP Integration Suite Trial Expiry
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I am currently using the SAP BTP Trial account with Integration Suite (Cloud Integration/CPI) enabled. I received a notification that my trial will expire in 6 days, and I would like to safely back up or export all my work (iFlows, Groovy scripts, value mappings, configurations, etc.) before the tenant is deactivated.

Here are my questions:

  1. What is the recommended approach to back up and restore iFlows (including scripts and settings)?

  2. Are there any tools or automation options to export multiple iFlows at once?

  3. Is there any way to request a trial extension, or must I create a new account?

  4. Will I have any access after expiry (read-only or grace period), or is everything permanently deleted?

I want to continue my learning journey and build more advanced integrations. If there‚Äôs any advice from others who migrated from one trial to another or upgraded, I‚Äôd appreciate the guidance!

Thanks in advance üôè

entry.title: FaultMessage handling in synchronous XI to REST CPI scenario
entry.content:
Hello community.

I have to implement a synchronous XI to REST scenario using Integration Suite (CPI) as the integrator.

In the SAP backend system I have a proxy consumer class with output and input structures for the request and response messages respectively. It also has a Fault Message Type structure to receive any error returned by the REST call.

The REST call is a simple HTTP GET request with some parameters.

I have implemented the REST call with a request reply external call and HTTP receiver adapter.

When the request is valid and I get a valid response from the target system, everything works fine and I get correct data in the input structure in the SAP backend proxy consumer class.

But when the request is invalid, for example one of the parameters is wrong or does not exist in the target system, the target system responses with an error captured by the HTTP receiver adapter. I'm handling this error in a exception subprocess and building correctly the fault message response, but the proxy consumer class in the SAP backend system is not receiving it correctly, the Fault Message Type structure is not populated.

In the integration engine monitor I get errors:

Inside the message, the payload is an HTMLError instead of a text/plain MainDocument and is marked as SystemError instead of ApplicationError:

Inside the HTMLError payload is the correct correct message but it seems like the proxy consumer class can not read it:

I have tried forcing the header Content-Type to 'text/plain' and 'application/xml' without success, same result on the SAP backend side.

 

What am I doing wrong or missing?

 

Thanks in advance for any help.

entry.title: Process messages in Controlled Manner in Cloud Integration
entry.content:
Hi Team,

Third party system sending messages to CPI   like 10K and we are able to process it but receiver system another third party has rate restriction at their end., means they will allow only 500 messages per hour

we tried many options like Data store but client is interested using JMS 

problem is when the messages are sent to JMS receiver and fetched from JMS queue sender, their is no option to process them in controlled manner

can you suggest any approach ?

entry.title: How to connect to a On-Premise SFTP server from SAP CI via Groovy through Cloud Connector - CF env
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I have a requirement where I need to connect to a on-prem SFTP server / servers and share the list of file names , directories , subdirectories names everyday with a third party application. 

I do not want to read the file content in read only mode nd then construct my own directory tree as that would mean bandwidth consumption.

I want to connect to the SFTP server - on prem through cloud connector at this stage from a groovy script in SAP CI using basic auth / cert auth. 

Would be really helpful if anyone has connected to a on prem sftp server from groovy in SAP CI. Can you please hare some insights / code for this requirement?  

Regards

Vinay

entry.title: How to schedule integrations after SuccessFactors Employee central data centers move to UTC time zon
entry.content:
Hello Experts, 

Considering the fact that all SuccessFactors data centers have moved to the UTC time zone, how can one schedule Cloud platform integrations to correctly pick up records that have become effective on a certain day?

Details - Let's assume my SF EC data center is in Tokyo. And let's also assume that I run my HRIS synch at 1 AM UTC, which is 10 AM JST. The future dated Job information records will become current dated only after the HRIS sync (I could be wrong here). So, in this case, only if I run the integration after 1:15 UTC (10:15 AM JST) will the integration pick up all the records that have become effective on that day. If I run the integration at around 4 AM, the UTC time is still 7 PM the previous day and it won't pick up the records that have become effective on the current day. 

Is there a solution to this? How can I manage to pick up all the records that have become effective on a certain day (along with changes since the last time the integration ran), when I run the integration early in the morning, when it's still the previous day in UTC time zone?

I am currently using Compound Employee SOAP call with last modified on and fromDate/toDate filters. 

Thanks

Kriba
